xvelAlt1.description: Cartesian X velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt1ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

yvelAlt1.description: Cartesian Y velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt1ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

zvelAlt1.description: Cartesian Z velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt1ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

alt1ReferenceFrame.description: The reference frame of the alternate1 (Alt1) cartesian orbital state.

xposAlt2.description: Cartesian X position of the target, in kilometers, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

yposAlt2.description: Cartesian Y position of the target, in kilometers, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

zposAlt2.description: Cartesian Z position of the target, in kilometers, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

xvelAlt2.description: Cartesian X velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

yvelAlt2.description: Cartesian Y velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

zvelAlt2.description: Cartesian Z velocity of the target, in kilometers/second, in the specified alt2ReferenceFrame. Alternate reference frames are optional and are intended to allow a data source to provide an equivalent vector in a different cartesian frame than the primary vector.

alt2ReferenceFrame.description: The reference frame of the alternate2 (Alt2) cartesian orbital state.

posUnc.description: One sigma position uncertainty, in kilometers.

velUnc.description: One sigma velocity uncertainty, in kilometers/second.

mass.description: The mass of the object, in kilograms.

area.description: The actual area of the object at it's largest cross-section, expressed in meters^2.

solarRadPressCoeff.description: Area-to-mass ratio coefficient for solar radiation pressure.

dragCoeff.description: Area-to-mass ratio coefficient for atmospheric ballistic drag (m2/kg).

dragArea.description: The effective area of the object exposed to atmospheric drag, expressed in meters^2.

geopotentialModel.description: Geopotential model used for this vector (e.g. EGM-96, WGS-84, WGS-72, JGM-2, or GEM-T3), including mm degree zonals, nn degree/order tesserals. E.g. EGM-96 24Z,24T.

dragModel.description: The Drag Model used for this vector (e.g. HARRIS-PRIESTER, JAC70, JBH09, MSIS90, NONE, etc.).

lunarSolar.description: Boolean indicating use of lunar/solar perturbations for this vector.

solarRadPress.description: Boolean indicating use of solar radiation pressure perturbations for this vector.

srpArea.description: The effective area of the object exposed to solar radiation pressure, expressed in meters^2.

solidEarthTides.description: Boolean indicating use of solid earth tide perturbations for this vector.

inTrackThrust.description: Boolean indicating use of in-track thrust perturbations for this vector.

edr.description: Model parameter value for energy dissipation rate (EDR) (w/kg).

thrustAccel.description: Model parameter value for thrust acceleration (m/s2).

cmOffset.description: Model parameter value for center of mass offset (m).

lastObStart.description: The start of the time interval containing the time of the last accepted observation, in ISO 8601 UTC format with microsecond precision.  For an exact observation time, the firstObTime and lastObTime are the same.

lastObEnd.description: The end of the time interval containing the time of the last accepted observation, in ISO 8601 UTC format with microsecond precision.  For an exact observation time, the firstObTime and lastObTime are the same.

obsAvailable.description: The number of observations available for the OD of the object.

obsUsed.description: The number of observations accepted for the OD of the object.

tracksAvail.description: The number of sensor tracks available for the OD of the object.

tracksUsed.description: The number of sensor tracks accepted for the OD of the object.

recODSpan.description: The recommended OD time span calculated for the object, expressed in days.

actualODSpan.description: The actual time span used for the OD of the object, expressed in days.

residualsAcc.description: The percentage of residuals accepted in the OD of the object.

solarFluxF10Avg.description: F10 (10.7 cm) solar flux 81-day average value.

taiUtc.description: TAI (Temps Atomique International) minus UTC (Universal Time Coordinates) offset in seconds.

ut1Utc.description: Universal Time-1 (UT1) minus UTC offset, in seconds.

ut1Rate.description: Rate of change of UT1 (milliseconds/day) - first derivative of ut1Utc.

iau1980Terms.description: Number of terms used in the IAU 1980 nutation model (4, 50, or 106).

leapSecondTime.description: Time of the next leap second after epoch in ISO 8601 UTC time. If the next leap second is not known, the time of the previous leap second is used.

partials.description: Type of partial derivatives used (ANALYTIC, FULL NUM, or FAST NUM).

stepMode.description: Integrator step mode (AUTO, TIME, or S).

fixedStep.description: Boolean indicating use of fixed step size for this vector.

stepSizeSelection.description: Initial step size selection (AUTO or MANUAL).

sigmaPosUVW.description: Array containing the standard deviation of error in target object position, U, V and W direction respectively (km).

sigmaVelUVW.description: Array containing the standard deviation of error in target object velocity, U, V and W direction respectively (km/sec).

rms.description: The Weighted Root Mean Squared (RMS) of the differential correction on the target object that produced this vector.  WRMS is a quality indicator of the state vector update, with a value of 1.00 being optimal.  WRMS applies to Batch Least Squares (BLS) processes.

effectiveFrom.description: Start time at which this state vector was the 'current' state vector for its satellite.

effectiveUntil.description: End time at which this state vector was no longer the 'current' state vector for its satellite.

rawFileURI.description: Optional URI location in the document repository of the raw file parsed by the system to produce this record. To download the raw file, prepend https://udl-hostname/scs/download?id= to this value.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

tags.description: Optional array of provider/source specific tags for this data, where each element is no longer than 32 characters, used for implementing data owner conditional access controls to restrict access to the data. Should be left null by data providers unless conditional access controls are coordinated with the UDL team.

algorithm.description: Optional algorithm used to produce this record.

sourcedData.description: Optional array of UDL data (observation) UUIDs used to build this state vector. See the associated sourcedDataTypes array for the specific types of observations for the positionally corresponding UUIDs in this array (the two arrays must match in size).

sourcedDataTypes.description: Optional array of UDL observation data types used to build this state vector (e.g. EO, RADAR, RF, DOA). See the associated sourcedData array for the specific UUIDs of observations for the positionally corresponding data types in this array (the two arrays must match in size).

createdAt.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

createdBy.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

descriptor.description: Optional source-provided and searchable metadata or descriptor of the data.

transactionId.description: Optional identifier to track a commercial or marketplace transaction executed to produce this data.

origNetwork.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

sourceDL.description: The source data library from which this record was received. This could be a remote or tactical UDL or another data library. If null, the record should be assumed to have originated from the primary Enterprise UDL.

StateVector.title: StateVector
StateVector.description: This service provides operations for querying and manipulation of state vectors for OnOrbit objects. State vectors are cartesian vectors of position (r) and velocity (v) that, together with their time (epoch) (t), uniquely determine the trajectory of the orbiting body in space. J2000 is the preferred coordinate frame for all state vector positions/velocities in UDL, but in some cases data may be in another frame depending on the provider and/or datatype. Please see the 'Discover' tab in the storefront to confirm coordinate frames by data provider.

EOObservation_ReferenceFrame.title: EOObservation_ReferenceFrame
EOObservation_ReferenceFrame.description: The reference frame of the EOObservation measurements. If the referenceFrame is null it is assumed to be J2000.

id.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system.

idOnOrbit.description: UUID of the parent Onorbit record.

classificationMarking.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

lastObTime.description: Time of last reported observation for this object in ISO 8601 UTC with microsecond precision.

rcs.description: Current/latest radar cross section in meters squared.

rcsMin.description: Minimum radar cross section in meters squared.

rcsMax.description: Maximum radar cross section in meters squared.

rcsMean.description: Mean radar cross section in meters squared.

bolDeltaV.description: The total beginning of life delta V of the spacecraft, in meters per second.

maxDeltaV.description: Maximum delta V available for this on-orbit spacecraft, in meters per second.

deltaVUnc.description: The 1-sigma uncertainty of the total spacecraft delta V, in meters per second.

estDeltaVDuration.description: Estimated maximum burn duration for the object, in seconds.

numMission.description: The number of distinct missions the spacecraft performs.

missionTypes.description: Array of the type of missions the spacecraft performs. Must contain the same number of elements as the value of numMission.

busType.description: Type of the bus on the spacecraft.

geoSlot.description: GEO slot if applicable, in degrees. -180 (West of Prime Meridian) to 180 degrees (East of Prime Meridian). Prime Meridian is 0.

driftRate.description: GEO drift rate, if applicable in degrees per day.

dryMass.description: Spacecraft dry mass (without fuel or disposables) in kilograms.

additionalMass.description: Mass of fuel and disposables at launch time in kilograms.

launchMassMin.description: Minimum (estimated) mass of spacecraft and fuel at launch time, in kilograms.

launchMass.description: Nominal mass of spacecraft and fuel at launch time, in kilograms.

launchMassMax.description: Maximum (estimated) mass of spacecraft and fuel at launch time, in kilograms.

bolFuelMass.description: Spacecraft beginning of life fuel mass, in orbit, in kilograms.

currentMass.description: The estimated total current mass of the spacecraft, in kilograms.

totalMassUnc.description: The 1-sigma uncertainty of the total spacecraft mass, in kilograms.

solarArrayArea.description: Spacecraft deployed area of solar array in meters squared.

maneuverable.description: Boolean indicating whether a spacecraft is maneuverable. Note that a spacecraft may have propulsion capability but may not be maneuverable due to lack of fuel, anomalous condition, or other operational constraints.

fuelRemaining.description: Estimated remaining fuel for the object in kilograms.

crossSection.description: Average cross sectional area in meters squared.

busCrossSection.description: Average cross sectional area of the bus in meters squared.

maxRadius.description: Maximum dimension across the spacecraft (e.g., tip-to-tip across the solar panel arrays) in meters.

colaRadius.description: Maximum dimension of the box circumscribing the spacecraft (d = sqrt(a*a + b*b + c*c) where a is the tip-to-tip dimension, b and c are perpendicular to that.) in meters.

adeptRadius.description: The radius used for long-term debris environment projection analyses that is not as conservative as COLA Radius, in meters.

numDeployable.description: The number of sub-satellites or deployable objects on the spacecraft.

depNames.description: Array of satellite deployable objects. Must contain the same number of elements as the value of numDeployable.

depEstMasses.description: Array of the estimated mass of each deployable object, in kilograms. Must contain the same number of elements as the value of numDeployable.

depMassUncs.description: Array of the 1-sigma uncertainty of the mass for each deployable object, in kilograms. Must contain the same number of elements as the value of numDeployable.

refSource.description: The reference source, sources, or URL from which the data in this record was obtained.

origin.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.
